definition: bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: She took everything for granted after the fashion of wealthy and pampered girls.
sentences.chinese: 她也像那些被寵壞的富家女一樣把什麼都不當回事。

sentences.english: He is the spoiled child of that household.
sentences.chinese: 他是那家被寵壞了的孩子。

sentences.english: We have been spoiled by the hand-held devices.
sentences.chinese: 我們已經被手持設備寵壞了。

sentences.english: “Mom didn't want Hilary to become a spoiled26 brat27,” says Haylie.
sentences.chinese: “媽媽不想把希拉里寵壞了，”海莉說。

sentences.english: That spoiled brat is used to having his own way.
sentences.chinese: 那位被寵壞的小孩習慣於我行我素。

sentences.english: She was spoiled by her father.
sentences.chinese: 她讓她的父親給寵壞了。

sentences.english: Schimkat's family back in the United States teases her that she's spoiled.
sentences.chinese: 回到美國的時候，施米卡特家笑話說她被寵壞了。

sentences.english: He is just a brat spoiled kid.
sentences.chinese: 但演得卻是一個被寵壞的毛頭小子。

sentences.english: Edmund and Lucy return to Narnia with their spoilt cousin Eustace Scrubb.
sentences.chinese: 艾文和魯思與他們被寵壞了的表弟尤斯特回到納尼亞。

sentences.english: She is making a rod for her own back by spoiling her son like that.
sentences.chinese: 她把兒子寵壞了，她是在自找苦喫。

sentences.english: A pet lamb makes a cross ram.
sentences.chinese: 寵壞的小羊將變成脾氣壞的大羊。

sentences.english: 'He's very much pampered and spoiled by his parents. '
sentences.chinese: 他被父母寵壞了，嬌養慣了。

sentences.english: A spoiled lamb will become an overbearing sheep.
sentences.chinese: 被寵壞的小羊將會長成蠻橫的大羊。

sentences.english: A pet lamb dos a cross ram.
sentences.chinese: 寵壞的小羊將成了脾氣壞的大羊。

sentences.english: Badly doted by the one you love, is the extreme bad happiness.
sentences.chinese: 被自己所愛的人寵壞，是最幸福的一種壞。

sentences.english: This small child is quite self-centered. Maybe he is spoiled by his family.
sentences.chinese: 這個小孩挺以自我爲中心的，可能是被家人寵壞了。

definition: to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to snub/to consign to the trash heap of history
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to do what one is told/obedient
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
